Text.Value: Looks like our man Halsin. Rest in peace, big guy.
We won't be getting any help from him. He's only good for compost now.
He won't be any help now. Not that he would have been much help before.
*What was once a living bear is now a dead elf. You fear the worst - could this be the Archdruid of the Emerald Grove...?*
He looks druidic enough to be our friend Halsin. Not that his corpse is going to be any help.
He won't be of much help to us now.
I have a bad feeling that dead elf is Halsin. He can't help us now.
*The corpse before you is no longer that of a bear, but an elf - albeit a large one. Curious.*
He won't be able to help us no - unless he happens to have a cure on his corpse.
Gods - I wager the dead elf is Halsin. He won't be helping us now.
That dead elf - Halsin, I assume. He won't be helping anyone now...
There goes our big lead. Damn.

EditorData.logicalname: Check more than one party member

Text.Value: What a shame. He could have been our key to a cure.
I have a bad feeling that dead elf is Halsin.
A dead elf? This must be the druid Halsin.
He looks like a druid, all right. Halsin, I presume?
Looks like our man Halsin. Rest in peace, big guy.
Gods. I think that's Halsin, the druid.
The dead elf must be Halsin. As much help to us now as he would be alive.
*If there's any hope of finding a cure, it's not here. Not any longer.*
A dead elf? The druid Halsin, most certainly.

Synopsis: If Halsin is killed in bear form in the Wolf Pens and the party knew about Halsin, the companions comment on the fact that the large dead elf who can turn in to a bear was probably the druid they were sent to find. Oops.
